description: Classic sweep using knee shield and sleeve control with scissoring leg motion to off-balance opponent
key_points: Establish knee shield across torso|Control same-side sleeve|Chop back leg while driving knee through|Maintain sleeve control throughout
common_mistakes: Opening guard too early|Not controlling the sleeve|Insufficient hip movement|Chopping leg instead of scissoring

description: Explosive sit-up sweep capitalizing on opponent's low posture or hands-on-mat position
key_points: Wait for opponent to post hands on mat|Sit up explosively with posting hand|Throw opposite arm over shoulder|Follow momentum to mount
common_mistakes: Hesitating on the sit-up|Not controlling the arm|Attempting when opponent has good posture|Insufficient explosion

description: High-amplitude sweep using pendulum leg motion and opponent's sleeve and pants control
key_points: Control sleeve and same-side pants at knee|Open guard and swing pendulum leg wide|Use momentum to sweep to mount|Keep grips tight throughout
common_mistakes: Insufficient momentum on pendulum|Releasing grips too early|Not opening guard fully|Poor timing
counters: Base wide|Let go of grips|Stack pass attempt

description: Sweep used when opponent stands in closed guard by elevating with butterfly-style hook
key_points: When opponent stands, underhook one leg|Control wrist on same side|Elevate with hook while pulling wrist|Follow to top position
common_mistakes: Not maintaining wrist control|Poor hook placement|Attempting too early|Not following to top
counters: Passing over leg|Disengaging quickly|Knee slice pass

description: Sweep that sends opponent overhead using feet on hips when they drive forward aggressively
key_points: Place feet on hips when opponent drives forward|Control sleeves or collar and sleeve|Pull opponent forward while extending legs|Roll back and over to mount
common_mistakes: Feet slipping off hips|Insufficient pull on upper body|Poor timing with leg extension|Not committing to the roll

description: Sweep from closed guard where you kick leg over opponent's head while rolling laterally
key_points: Control opposite sleeve|Open guard and swing same-side leg over opponent's head|Roll laterally toward controlled arm|Follow through to top position
common_mistakes: Poor sleeve control|Not opening guard fully|Insufficient hip turn|Telegraphing the sweep

description: Using hip bump motion to create angle for back take when opponent defends by posting
key_points: Start hip bump sweep|When opponent posts to defend, establish underhook|Technical stand while maintaining hook|Take back or come to top
common_mistakes: Poor timing on transition|Losing underhook|Not following opponent|Hesitating mid-transition

description: Classic closed guard submission trapping opponent's head and arm between legs in figure-four configuration
key_points: Control posture with collar or head|Shoot hips up and lock triangle|Cut angle toward trapped arm side|Squeeze knees together while pulling head down
common_mistakes: Not cutting the angle|Legs too loose|Not breaking posture first|Attacking from flat position

description: Fundamental armbar isolating opponent's arm while controlling with hips and legs across body
key_points: Control wrist and elbow|Pivot hips perpendicular to opponent|Swing leg over face while holding arm tight|Pinch knees and extend hips for finish
common_mistakes: Not controlling the arm throughout|Hips too far from armpit|Legs not tight|Extending before positioning

description: Figure-four shoulder lock attacking opponent's bent arm from closed guard position
key_points: Break posture and control wrist|Sit up and establish figure-four grip|Fall to hip while maintaining control|Rotate arm behind back
common_mistakes: Not sitting up enough|Loose grip|Allowing opponent to posture|Not controlling elbow

description: Shoulder lock using leg over opponent's shoulder with forward pressure while seated
key_points: Control opposite wrist|Swing leg over shoulder|Sit up and secure position|Apply forward pressure on shoulder
common_mistakes: Not sitting up|Allowing opponent to roll|Poor wrist control|Not securing position before pressure

description: Classic gi choke using deep cross grips on opponent's collar to create blood choke
key_points: Establish deep grip with thumb inside collar|Second grip crosses over first arm|Pull elbows tight to body|Squeeze forearms together
common_mistakes: Grips not deep enough|Elbows flaring out|Not breaking posture first|Hands too close together

description: Front headlock choke applied when opponent dives head first into closed guard
key_points: Wrap arm around neck when head drops|Secure grip (chin-strap or blade)|Close guard high on back|Crunch down while extending hips
common_mistakes: Head not deep enough in armpit|Hips not elevated|Not closing guard|Loose grip
counters: Posturing up|Pulling head out|Passing to side

description: Transition from closed guard to back control when opponent defends sweeps
key_points: When opponent bases wide, swim for underhook|Hip escape while maintaining closed guard|Climb to opponent's back using hooks|Establish seatbelt control
common_mistakes: Losing hook control|Not maintaining connection|Poor timing|Telegraphing movement

description: Fundamental closed guard technique to break opponent's upright posture before attacking
key_points: Grip behind head or on collar|Pull elbows toward mat|Climb legs high on opponent's back|Use core to maintain broken posture
common_mistakes: Only pulling with arms|Letting legs drop|Not maintaining pressure|Releasing grips too early

description: Essential grip controlling opponent's wrist/sleeve to enable sweeps and submissions
key_points: Grip at wrist or sleeve cuff|Control with pistol grip|Pin to hip or mat|Maintain throughout technique chains
common_mistakes: Loose grip|Allowing posture|Single grip only|Not pinning effectively

description: Active guard control climbing legs high on opponent's back to break posture and set up attacks
key_points: Uncross ankles and climb legs higher|Squeeze knees against ribs|Pull with heels on lower back|Combine with collar control
common_mistakes: Feet crossed too low|Loose leg squeeze|Not using heels actively|Passive guard

description: Sneaky choke from closed guard threading arm behind head and through sleeve to strangle
key_points: Secure arm behind opponent's head|Thread hand through own sleeve|Place blade of forearm across throat|Close guard tight and squeeze
common_mistakes: Forearm not on throat|Loose guard position|Telegraphing the attack|Insufficient squeeze
counters: Posturing up|Chin down defense|Stripping sleeve grip

description: Quick transition using arm drag to expose opponent's back or off-balance for sweeps
key_points: Control at wrist and tricep|Pull arm across your body|Sit up while dragging|Take back or sweep
common_mistakes: Not sitting up|Loose grip on tricep|Slow execution|Not following through

description: Combination attack using hip bump to force reaction that opens triangle choke
key_points: Begin hip bump sweep|When opponent posts, redirect to triangle|Lock triangle on posting arm|Finish triangle choke
common_mistakes: Poor transition timing|Not controlling arm|Triangle too loose|Flat positioning

description: Classic closed guard attack chain flowing between three complementary submissions
key_points: Attack armbar first|When defended, transition to triangle|If arm extracted, flow to omoplata|Continue cycling based on defense
common_mistakes: Static attacking|Losing position between transitions|Poor angle management|Giving up between attempts

description: Flexible guard position pulling own ankle behind opponent's head for maximum control
key_points: From closed guard, pull ankle behind opponent's head|Secure with same-side hand|Maintain broken posture|Attack with omoplata or gogoplata
common_mistakes: Insufficient flexibility|Losing head position|Not maintaining tension|Overreaching

description: Rare shin choke from rubber guard position placing shin across opponent's throat
key_points: Establish rubber guard or mission control|Insert shin across throat|Pull head down with hands|Apply pressure with shin
common_mistakes: Poor rubber guard setup|Shin not on throat|Insufficient pulling pressure|Losing position
counters: Posturing up|Moving head to side|Stripping leg

description: High guard variation with leg over opponent's shoulder creating strong control and arm attacks
key_points: From closed guard, throw leg over opponent's shoulder|Overhook the arm at tricep|Maintain strong head control|Attack armbar or omoplata
common_mistakes: Losing head control|Shoulder not trapped|Flat positioning|No angle
counters: Posturing to strip leg|Pulling arm free|Stacking

description: Combined attack threatening both cross choke and armbar simultaneously from closed guard
key_points: Establish deep collar grip|Control opposite arm at wrist|Threaten both attacks|Finish whichever opponent defends less
common_mistakes: Only focusing on one attack|Poor grip depth|Not maintaining pressure|Telegraphing preferred attack

description: Transition from closed guard to lasso spider guard when opponent stands or creates distance
key_points: When opponent stands, maintain sleeve grips|Thread leg around arm for lasso|Place other foot on bicep|Attack from spider/lasso position
common_mistakes: Losing sleeve grips|Poor timing|Not committing to transition|Passive guard play

description: Transition from closed guard to butterfly guard when opponent disengages or stands
key_points: Open guard and bring feet to inside hooks|Sit up to face opponent|Establish underhook or collar tie|Attack with butterfly sweeps or arm drag
common_mistakes: Passive transition|Losing upper body connection|Not sitting up|Slow hook insertion

description: Technical sweep using hip movement and tripod-like leg positioning from guard
key_points: Control sleeves or wrists|Post feet on hips and one on ground|Hip out and sweep with pressure|Come to top immediately
common_mistakes: Poor timing|Not controlling upper body|Weak hip movement|Not following to top

description: Wrist hyperflexion attack from closed guard isolating and bending opponent's wrist
key_points: Isolate opponent's wrist|Control forearm with both hands|Hyperextend wrist toward opponent|Apply gradual pressure
common_mistakes: Not isolating elbow|Too much force too fast|Poor angle|Loose control

description: Method to safely stand from guard while maintaining defensive position and potential attacks
key_points: Post one hand behind|Step opposite foot up|Drive off foot while maintaining guard|Come to standing with grips
common_mistakes: Poor hand placement|Not maintaining guard|Standing too slowly|Exposed to strikes
